TestCase.Discription:
Description:
If the Intel Android target supports multiple simultaneous displays and they are connected to the target at boot time, then the target shall provide an extended user interface to support the use of applications with such displays in the following ways:
1. Under the Android settings "Dual Display" options menu, a list of applications are presented to the user whereby a single application may be selected to present itself on the secondary display. Any application installed in the device may be selected to be used with the external display, without modification to the application.
2. Once an application is selected in the options menu then the content and user interface associated with said application shall be presented on the specified alternate display, scaled to fit at full-screen size. There may be one or two external displays supporting this extended user interface, each with their own unique application content.
3. User inputs from (a) virtual keyboards, (b) USB HID devices (eg. mouse cursor or keyboard), and (c) additional touch screen hardware associated with the external display are possible input interfaces to the applications presented on an alternate display and shall route to the applications utilizing the alternate display when the application is in focus.
See the attached powerpoint for more details on this feature.
This is a use case for AREQ-16244
